availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
agst } Jefferson Circuit Sct
Thos Stevens

Affiants state that on the day of 1862. I, was caled by C L Stancliff Chief of the Police of Louisville I being a Notary Public of Jefferson County to take the dying declaration of a man at the Wm Tell Coffe howse between 4th & 5 street and Market Streit, in the City of Louisville, I, accompanyd Mr Stancliff to the roome were the Man was Lying I informed him that he was in a dying situation and I, had caled at the initent of Mr. Stancliff who was then present to take his dying decleration and he made nowe reply I then asked him if he knew ho sthot and he said he did
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 27th day of October 1862.
Jos Clement J P J C

Commonwealth
vs } Affadavit
A. Maas
Tom Stevens
1862 Oct 30th Filed in Court
